document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

Netelia (Bessobates) latungula :

subSubSection.paragraph: ♂. Head ( Figs 42, 43 ) 1.7–1.8 times as wide as long; vertex in dorsal view evenly rounded; occiput and interocellar area polished and impunctate; vertex and gena finely and weakly punctate; geno-orbital index 2.3–2.8 ; frons impunctate and finely coriaceous, without a median longitudinal groove or with a very weak groove; inner margins of eyes convergent ventrally; face 1.4–1.6 times as wide as long, strongly punctate; supraclypeal suture weak; clypeus 2.1–2.5 times as wide as long, rather more sparsely punctate than face, with apical margin truncate; antenna with 41–47 flagellomeres, 1 st flagellomere 1.4–1.5 times as long as 2 nd, 2 nd 2.4–2.8 times as long as wide.
Fore tibial spur 0.4–0.5 times as long as 1 st tarsomere, which is 8.9–9.2 times as long as wide, fore tarsal claw with 19–23 pectines; hind tarsal claw with 14–16 pectines.

Head yellow; occiput brownish-yellow; antenna reddish-yellow. Mesosoma yellow to brownish-yellow; in some specimens, mesoscutum with brownish-yellow to brown stripes on each of median and lateral lobes; scutellum and dorsal portion of propodeum brownish. Wings hyaline; vein C and pterostigma of fore wing brownish-yellow; hind tarsus whitish-yellow. Metasoma brownish-yellow to reddish-brown.

Specimens examined. [Hokkaido]

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 42–46. Male of
Netelia ( Bessobates ) latungula
. 42, Head in dorsal view; 43, head in frontal view; 44, mesosoma in dorsal view; 45, fore wing; 46, hind wing.

FIGURES 47–52. Male subgenital plate and genitalia of
Netelia ( Bessobates )
spp. 47–49,
Netelia ( Bessobates ) kiuhabona
; 50–52,
N . ( B .) latungula
; 47, 50, subgenital plate; 48, 51, paramere in mesal view; 49, 52, aedeagus in lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution. Japan (Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku, Kyushu), across the Holarctic region. Remarks.
Townes ( 1938 )
placed this species in the
virgata
group. However,
latungula
is different from
virgata
in the absences of overhang and strip of minutely papillate cuticle on the mesal surface of paramere, and shares the shape of the digitus with
virgata
and
kiuhabona
. Thus, this species can not be assigned to any species group.
